content: How can I use Python to transform the phrase "The cat meowed" into an italicized form in CSS, with the feline's vocalization denoted in a slanted font? Can you provide a sample code for this transformation? Also, please ensure that the font size of the slanted font is 2 points larger than the regular font size.

To transform the phrase "The cat meowed" into an italicized form in CSS with the feline's vocalization denoted in a slanted font, you can use Python to generate the HTML and CSS needed for this formatting. Below is a sample code that demonstrates how to achieve this: ```python # Define the phrase and the parts to be styled phrase = "The cat meowed" regular_text = "The cat" italic_text = "meowed" # Define the CSS for styling css_style = """ """ # Create the HTML with embedded CSS html_content = f""" {css_style}
{regular_text} {italic_text}
""" # Print the HTML content print(html_content) ``` When this code is executed in a Python environment, it generates an HTML string with embedded CSS styles that you can use in a web page. The part of the phrase "The cat" is styled with a regular font, while "meowed" is italicized and has a font size 2 points larger than the regular text. To view the result, you can save the output HTML content into an `.html` file and open it in a web browser.
